etymology.description: 断 'refuse' + 舍 'discard' + 离 'separate' = deliberate decluttering and detachment
etymology.interpretation: Borrowed from Japanese 断捨離, it advocates refusing unnecessary inputs, discarding excess, and separating from attachment to live minimally.
etymology.simplification: All three characters are simplified: 斷→断, 捨→舍, 離→离; stroke counts were reduced to speed writing by dropping or streamlining complex components.

parts.english: to cut off; to sever; to refuse; to stop
to discard; to give up; to abandon; to let go
to separate; to leave; to part from; to distance from

examples.chinese: 我开始断舍离(我開始斷捨離)。
清理杂物后(清理雜物後)，家里更整洁(家裡更整潔)。
examples.pinyin: Qīnglǐ záwù hòu, jiālǐ gèng zhěngjié.
examples.english: After clearing clutter, the home is tidier.

examples.chinese: 断舍离帮助我专注重要的事(斷捨離幫助我專注重要的事)。
examples.pinyin: Duànshělí bāngzhù wǒ zhuānzhù zhòngyào de shì.
examples.english: Minimalism helps me focus on what matters.
